intro: Hieracium inconstrictum var. taeniifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in grassy areas, meadows, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while the flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. It is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
